addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord,
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

2 Fe
b
1591.
M
r
Bodeleie to my L.
Casimirs
death.
M. Bilant
[answer] notw
th
standing his meanes to
e Contrary /
Reward to
e Messenger /

page.lettertext:
fol.92r
May it please yo
r
good L. to yo
r
letter
of
e 18 of
e last, w
ch
I receaved at this
instant, because
e newes are confirmed of
D. Cassimires death, there is nothing to replie.
The partie sent hither w
t
e l
re
s of
e Duke,
departed from hens about 20 daies sins:
and then I made him an answear, to
e self
same effect, as yo
r
L. required: but to
e
Duke himself I writte but a worde of credence.
But
e messenger came to late, to finde him
alive. For he died, we heare,
e 6 of Ja
n
and
e
yong Electo
r
hath taken upon him
e
government of
e contrey. Howe
desirous I was to impeache
e comming hither
of Mons
r
de Bilandt, yo
r
L. will perceave
by that w
ch
I writte
e 27 of
e last, w
ch
I see
w
t
other l
re
s, for want of a winde is not come
to yo
r
handes. But for as muche as he is
come, I hope
at all
e dealing, w
ch
I have
used w
t
him, or shall use upon occasion, that
he may minister heereafter, will be still w
t
in my boundes, and so as alwaies her
Ma
tie
may turne it to advantage. The
states,
it is thought, will be mette w
t
in this
sevenight, who by all
at I can judge, and
see into their doinges, are no otherwise inclined
then I have alwaies advertised: and w
t
all
I doe not doubt, but they will give
e Am-
bassado
r
his dispatche out of hand.
And thus
I take my humble leave. At
e Hage. Fe
b
2
1591.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
I have promised this bearer,
at if
yo
r
L. shall perceave, that he used
any diligence in
e speedy deliverie,
yow will vouchesafe to consider
of his charges and paines.
